Pole fitness classes in Chiang Mai, Thailand

For those who can't stand the gym or just want to try something new, pole fitness combines the best of dance and resistance training.

Strong is the new sexy

Classes

Learn pole dancing in a fun, friendly environment! Get fit while developing your abilities and confidence - at any level.

Classes are one and a half hours long, unless otherwise noted, and begin with a warm-up. All classes are open on a drop-in basis but availability is limited, so please get in touch to confirm attendance.

  • Starter Pole

    New to pole? Start here for the basics. The focus of this class is on the principles behind the moves, essential vocabulary, and safety. By the end of a class, you will have learned some moves and spins, and put them together in a fun routine! Open to all fitness levels. If you have dance or gymnastics experience, you'll probably move on after one class. Total newbie? Repeat this class until you feel ready to level up.

    ฿500

  • Beginner Pole

    For students with a good grasp of the basics, or with previous training at another studio at Levels 1 or 2. The focus of this class is on expanding your range of moves, holds, poses, spins, and transitions. Classes may incorporate floor work, and will primarily use static pole.

    ฿500

  • Intermediate Pole

    For students with experience and knowledge of a broad range of moves, or with previous training at another studio at Level 2 or above. The focus of this class is on refining your technique, so you can get off the ground with climbs and inverts. Classes will be more physically challenging, and will use both static and spinning pole.

    ฿500

  • Advanced Pole

    For students with a strong foundation in pole and ready to take it to the next level, ​or with previous training at Level 3 or above. The focus of this class will depend greatly on the student(s). Less class, more coaching, shape your own pole destiny!

    ฿500

  • Beginner Choreo

    Put your beginner moves to work in a choreographed routine emphasizing fluidity and musicality. Dance both on and off the pole in a short routine suitable for all fitness levels.

    ฿500

  • Intermediate Choreo

    Challenge yourself by combining pole moves that will take you around the pole, on the floor, upside-down, and everywhere in between, all while developing your musicality and artistry. Classes may be fast-paced and more physically challenging.

    ฿500

  • Exotic Choreo

    Explore the sexy side of pole! Routines will combine beginner moves with lots of hip circles, body waves, and attitude! Suitable for all fitness levels, women only.

    ฿500

  • Pole Power

    An energetic one-hour class to build your strength and stamina. Exercises take place both on and off the pole. Open to any fitness level - but expect to work.

    ฿400

  • Flex

    A relaxing one-hour class to help you with flexibility, posture, and range of motion. Yoga inspired moves take place off the pole. Suitable for all fitness levels.

    ฿400

  • Open Pole

    Want to practice that elusive move on your own time or choreograph a routine? Do your own thing during this one-hour unsupervised practice time. Open to all Intermediate or Advanced students - Beginner students must get instructor permission first.

    ฿200

  • Pole Jam

    Pole play time! A chance to mix and mingle with all levels, collaborate, and just have fun. These extended sessions are as much about socializing and having fun as they are about celebrating pole dance and fitness.

    ฿200

  • Private

    Get some one-on-one attention and set your own agenda during a one-hour class.

    ฿1500

Schedule

Monday: Beginner Pole 17:30 - 19:00

Wednesday: Beginner Pole 15:30 - 17:00

Additional private sessions available by appointment.

Location

Third Floor

About Us

You know that kid who never stopped moving? The one who performed at every goddamn talent show?
That was me 😜
I've danced on and off my whole life, but it wasn't until I discovered pole dance, that my passion became a need. Every time I left the studio, my brain would be buzzing with choreography ideas. I found it hard to get back to "real life" afterwards, and you won't believe the amount of time I've spent on YouTube watching the pros and screaming, "How did she do that?!?!" 🙌
Pole is such a fun challenge! The first time you attempt a trick, it seems impossible. You don't have the core-strength, your back doesn't bend that way, or it just hurts too much to grip with that part of your body... You keep trying though, practicing your own half-ass version of it until one day, you jump on the pole and fucking nail it. There is no high like it. One day you also look in the mirror and realize there's new muscles on your body. Somehow while you were having all that fun, you got strong 💪
I need more of this. I must pole dance all of the time. Everyone must know the joy of this fabulous exercise!
When I moved back to Chiang Mai, I couldn't find the right place to practice and challenge myself to take it to the next level. So I decided I needed to open my own studio 😄
I've started offering a handful of classes in a pop-up space, and hope to scale up to a dedicated studio by the end of the year. I'm no expert (I practice at about level 3/4) but I'd love to introduce you to the joys of pole, and if you're a hard-core pole dancer who finds yourself in Chiang Mai - I want you to have a place to practice. Teach pole? Awesome, let's figure out how to team up!
I'm so excited to get started, and I hope you are too.
